title: Fix file type display, reposition Upload Files button, restore breadcrumb colors, and bump version

requirements.summary: Display specific file types (JSON, Folder, etc.) in the Type column with 'N/A' for unknown types instead of showing the entire filename
acceptanceCriteria: Files with recognized types display their specific type label (e.g., 'JSON', 'Folder')
Files with unknown or unrecognized types display 'N/A' in the Type column
The entire filename is never displayed in the Type column

file_operations.description: Update the getFileTypeLabel function to ensure it returns 'N/A' for unknown or unrecognized file types instead of falling back to displaying the filename. Verify the function properly handles edge cases where file extensions cannot be determined.

Review the Type column rendering logic to ensure it uses getFileTypeLabel correctly and never displays the full filename as a fallback. Update any inline type display logic to consistently show specific type labels or 'N/A' for unknowns.
If the gallery view displays file types, update the type display logic to use the corrected getFileTypeLabel function and ensure 'N/A' is shown for unknown types instead of filenames.

requirements.summary: Reposition the 'Upload Files' button before 'New Folder' button with folder-button styling (subtle yellow border) while keeping blue color
acceptanceCriteria: Upload Files button appears before New Folder button in the toolbar
Upload Files button has a subtle yellow border similar to folder buttons
Upload Files button retains its blue color scheme

file_operations.description: Reorder the toolbar buttons so the 'Upload Files' button appears before the 'New Folder' button. Update the Upload Files button styling to add a subtle yellow border similar to the folder buttons while preserving its blue color scheme. Review the existing folder button classes and apply the appropriate border styling (e.g., border-yellow-500/30 or similar) to the Upload Files button.

requirements.summary: Restore the blue colors in the Drive path breadcrumb navigation (Drive > testup > test2 > test3) as shown in v0.4.121
acceptanceCriteria: Breadcrumb navigation path segments display in blue color
Visual appearance matches the v0.4.121 reference screenshot

file_operations.description: Locate the breadcrumb navigation rendering logic and restore the blue color styling to the path segments. The breadcrumb should display 'Drive > folder1 > folder2 > ...' with blue-colored links. Review the v0.4.121 reference screenshot (image-138.png shows blue breadcrumb links) and apply the appropriate text-blue-* classes or similar styling to match the previous appearance.

requirements.summary: Update the application version to v0.4.127
acceptanceCriteria: APP_VERSION constant in appVersion.ts is set to '0.4.127'
Version number displays correctly in the application footer

file_operations.description: Update the APP_VERSION constant from '0.4.126' to '0.4.127'.
